edu.umd.cs.datastructures.examcode.matrix

Class SquareMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umd.cs.datastructures.examcode.matrix.SquareMatrix
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SquareMatrixOne, SquareMatrixTwo

    public abstract class SquareMatrix
extends java.lang.Object

    Abstraction for a square matrix of Doubles. Implementation is completed by derived classes.

    See Also:
    SquareMatrixOne, SquareMatrixTwo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int dimension 
      protected java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double>> matrix 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
        SquareMatrix()
      The default constructor initializes the matrix with a default dimension tweakable by the implementation.
      protected SquareMatrix(int n)
      Parameterized protectedconstructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addColumn()
      Adds a right column of zeroes in the matrix.
      void addRow()
      Adds a bottom row of zeroes in the matrix.
      double get(int i, int j)
      Simple getter for the element at position (i, j) in the matrix.
      int getDimension()
      Deprecated. 
      Will not return the correct dimension if calls to addRow() addColumn() are made.
      protected void initialize()
      xInitializes the data store with zeroes.
      void set(double num, int i, int j)
      Simple setter for the element at position (i, j) in the matrix.

      • dimension

        protected int dimension

      • matrix

        protected java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double>> matrix

    • Constructor Detail

      • SquareMatrix

        public SquareMatrix()
        The default constructor initializes the matrix with a default dimension tweakable by the implementation.
        See Also:
        SquareMatrix(int)

      • SquareMatrix

        protected SquareMatrix(int n)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameterized protectedconstructor. To initialize our inner data store, we have more work to do which should be offloaded to actual implementors of this abstract class.

        Parameters:
        n - The dimension to initialize the square matrix with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        SquareMatrix()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()

        xInitializes the data store with zeroes. Derived classes access this method to initialize their specific stores.

      • getDimension

        public int getDimension()
        Deprecated. Will not return the correct dimension if calls to addRow() addColumn() are made.
        Simple getter for the matrix's dimension.
        Returns:
        The matrix's dimension.

      • addRow

        public void addRow()
        Adds a bottom row of zeroes in the matrix.

      • addColumn

        public void addColumn()
        Adds a right column of zeroes in the matrix.

      • get

        public double get(int i,
                  int j)
           throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Simple getter for the element at position (i, j) in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        i - The 0-based row index of the element.
        j - The 0-based column index of the element.
        Returns:
        The element at position (i, j).
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if either i or j are not valid indices for the matrix.

      • set

        public void set(double num,
                int i,
                int j)
         throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Simple setter for the element at position (i, j) in the matrix.
        Parameters:
        num - The double to insert.
        i - The 0-based row index of the element.
        j - The 0-based column index of the element.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if either i or j are not valid indices for the matrix.
